marketNews.title: Government Targets International Tourist Visits +45% YoY in 2024
marketNews.content: Tourism Minister and Creative Economy Minister Sandiaga Uno raised the target for foreign tourist arrivals (wisman) to Indonesia in 2024 from 14.3 million to 17 million. The target is 45.5% higher than the 2023 realization of 11.68 million arrivals. Sandiaga said that the increase is based on the solid 2023 performance, where foreign tourist arrivals grew 98.3% YoY and exceeded the 8.5 million target by 137.4%. According to BPS data, the 2023 foreign tourists were dominated by five countries: Malaysia (1.9 million), Australia (1.43 million), Singapore (1.41 million), China (787,924), and Timor Leste (728,586). The average stay length was between 7 and 12 nights. Hotel occupancy in Indonesia rose 2.84 percentage points in 2023 to 59.74%. Sandiaga is optimistic that tourism can support Indonesia's economic growth target of 5.2% in 2024. Planned initiatives to boost foreign arrivals include increasing the number of events and flights, and visa-free entry for 20 countries outside Southeast Asia. Although foreign arrivals far exceeded the 2023 target, Kompas reported that domestic tourist mobility (wisnus) in 2023 is unlikely to meet the target of 1.2-1.4 billion trips. BPS has not yet released the total domestic trips for 2023; however, data up to November 2023 showed 668.9 million trips, a 12% YoY increase but only 55.7% of the minimum target. The Ministry of Tourism and Creative Economy targets domestic mobility of 1.25-1.5 billion trips in 2024 and will cooperate with the Ministry of Transportation to lower air ticket prices, a major concern for domestic travelers. The 2024 foreign tourist target is higher than the pre-pandemic level of 16.1 million in 2019. If achieved, the increase could positively affect tourism-related issuers such as GIAA, PANR, and BAYU, as well as alcoholic beverage issuers like WINE, MLBI, DLTA, and BEER.

marketNews.title: DMAS: Conservative Marketing Sales Target for 2024
marketNews.content: DMAS (Puradelta Lestari) targets marketing sales of IDR 1.81 trillion in 2024, compared with the 2023 target of IDR 1.8 trillion, which is 3.2% lower than the 2023 realization of IDR 1.87 trillion. Director and Company Secretary Tondy Suwanto said the more conservative target reflects national economic growth and global geopolitical conditions, and noted that the company recorded a land demand of 90 hectares at the start of 2024. PTPP recorded a new contract value of IDR 3.5 trillion in January 2024, a 99.96% YoY increase, representing about 10.5% of the 2024 target of roughly IDR 33.3 trillion. New contracts in January were dominated by government projects (90.5%), followed by state-owned enterprises (7.76%) and private sector (1.74%). MMLP’s shareholder Bridge Leed Limited purchased 200 million MMLP shares from Provident Warehouse Pte. Ltd. at IDR 300 per share on 23 January 2024, a total transaction value of IDR 60 billion, raising Bridge Leed’s ownership from 14.61% to 17.51%. VOKS’s new controlling shareholder, Hengtong Optic-Electric International Co., Ltd., announced a mandatory tender offer of up to IDR 1.12 billion (26.95%) of VOKS shares at IDR 226 per share between 6 February and 6 March 2024, with a maximum corporate action value of IDR 253.1 billion. The tender follows Hengtong’s acquisition of a 42.97% stake in VOKS valued at IDR 403.56 billion. AMMN reported that the copper smelter and precious metal refining projects of its subsidiary Amman Mineral Industri reached 76.1% and 72.7% completion respectively as of December 2023, and are expected to be finished by the end of May 2024. The smelter will produce 222,000 tonnes of copper cathode and 830,000 tonnes of sulfuric acid per year, while the refining plant will produce 18 tonnes of gold bars, 55 tonnes of silver bars, and 70 tonnes of selenium per year.

marketNews.title: OECD Projects Global Growth 2024 at +2.9%
marketNews.content: The latest outlook from the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) projects global economic growth of 2.9% in 2024, higher than the November 2023 outlook of 2.7%. The upgrade is driven by a still-strong U.S. economy, potential interest-rate cuts, and declining inflation. The OECD also projects U.S. growth at 2.1% in 2024, up from the previous outlook of 1.5%.

marketNews.title: President Orders Temporary Budget Block Ahead of 2024 Election
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo instructed Finance Minister Sri Mulyani to temporarily block budget allocations amounting to IDR 50.14 trillion for ministries and agencies ahead of the 2024 presidential election. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the blocked funds will be used to increase social assistance and fertilizer subsidies.

marketNews.title: DPR Discusses Draft Law on Special Capital Region
marketNews.content: Speaker of the House of Representatives Puan Maharani said the DPR has received the President’s letter regarding the draft law on the Special Capital Region (DKJ). One proposal in the draft is that the governor and deputy governor of Jakarta would be appointed by the President after Jakarta no longer holds capital status. The draft has been approved by the DPR Legislative Body for further discussion.

marketNews.title: KPPU Investigates Monopoly Practices by Shopee and Google
marketNews.content: The Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU) is investigating alleged monopoly practices by Shopee and Google in Indonesia. KPPU Chair M. Fanshurullah Asa said Google Indonesia is suspected of monopolizing payment services through Google Pay, while Shopee Indonesia is alleged to monopolize parcel delivery services via Shopee Express.

tickerNews.content: If the 2024 foreign tourist target is achieved, the increase could positively affect tourism-related issuers such as GIAA.
